p: In Area 2, one treatment with each marker was applied, therefore only the period from 26 April to 5 June was considered. Milk solution was sprayed in a hazelnut orchard ( Table 2), and adults marked with casein were found in zones up to 590 m, in higher numbers in zones G and H (440 and 350 m, respectively) ( Figure 6). Egg white solution was sprayed on wild hazelnut ( Table 2), and marked adults were found at distances up to 590 m, in higher numbers in zones G and C (490 and 230 m, respectively) ( Figure 6). Total percentages of marked adults were equal for casein (17%) and albumin, whereas on average 8% of tested adults were positive for both casein and albumin.
